title: Health Literacy Improvement Program for Adolescents with Food Allergies in Social Meal Situations

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of food allergy concepts and proficiency in using digital learning platforms
context.additional_context: Education for parents in their 40s or older with adolescent children, focusing on self-directed learning in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment

learning_goals: Learners can improve their ability to evaluate and utilize food allergy-related information with over 80% accuracy
Learners can propose three or more communication strategies for adolescents to manage allergies in social dining situations

Learners must utilize three or more local resources (public health centers, welfare centers, pharmacies, etc.) to develop a personalized health management plan executable within a week and submit an implementation report fulfilling at least four of five checklist items.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
